revised_title: Weather Observations and Agricultural Impacts in Lyndon, 1795
tldr: This article documents the weather observations and their impact on agriculture in Lyndon, Rutland, during 1795. The author, Thomas Barker, records the frost, snow, and rain throughout the year, noting its effects on bridges, seed planting, and crop growth. The text also discusses the transition from winter to spring, summer, and autumn, highlighting the weather patterns and their influence on hay and harvest seasons. The year ended with a mild and warm winter, but with significant storminess and challenges for shipping.
